name: Requests received by controller
description: This PromQL query measures the total number of requests received by a controller, regardless of whether they were successful or failed.
question: How many requests were received by the controller?

description: Measures the total number of requests per second

name: In progress (global)
description: This PromQL query measures the total count of in-progress operations across all controllers globally.

name: Request duration (controller-handled requests only)
description: Measures the duration of requests that are handled by ASP.NET Core controllers only, excluding requests that were not mapped to a controller.
question: What is the average duration of requests handled by ASP.NET Core controllers?

name: Request duration (controller-handled requests only)
description: Measures the duration of requests that are handled by ASP.NET Core controllers only, excluding requests that were not mapped to a controller.
question: Which controller has the longest request duration?

question: How has the request duration trend changed over the last hour?

name: Error rate by controller
description: This PromQL query measures the error rate for HTTP requests by filtering out 4xx and 5xx status codes.
question: What is the error rate for HTTP requests with 4xx status codes?

name: Error rate by controller
description: This PromQL query measures the error rate for HTTP requests by filtering out 4xx and 5xx status codes.
question: What is the error rate for HTTP requests with 5xx status codes?

name: Error rate by controller
description: This PromQL query measures the error rate for HTTP requests by filtering out 4xx and 5xx status codes.
